page.title: 01Hungerford.
page.content: Hungerford is a small town in the countryside near Newbury in the west of Berkshire.It's twin town is Ligueil in France. It boasts a large area of open grassland,the Common,ideal for grazing cows,walking dogs and summer picnics. The restored barge "The Rose of Hungerford" takes visitors along the Kennet and Avon canal which runs through both common and town. Once a year people celebrate the old festival known as" Tutti Day".The Tutti men,dressed in top hat and tails, roam the streets distributing kisses,oranges and money. The town is famous for it's antique shops attracting many bargain hunters who are well catered for in the local pubs, hotels and eating places.
